snippet: About mid-day, I grew anxious for the arrival of my two companions, Cleghorn and Eobertson.

title: The complete works of Robert Burns.

snippet: My ever dear CLEGHORN, — The foregoing had been sent you long ago, but for reasons which you may have heard.

title: The complete works of Robert Burns.
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: He had not forgot his promise to Cleghorn to forward him a copy of what appears to have been the last song that was inspired by the witchery of Jean Lorimer — a song which seems to have been sung at the little dinner-party in the poet's house, already noticed, on the occasion of Cleghorn's visit to Dumfries  in August preceding.

title: The complete works of Robert Burns.
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: It appears certain that she did sing one of these — a fresh effusion, to the beautiful Gaelic tune, called "Morag," which so delighted Cleghorn that on his return to Edinburgh he wrote for a copy of it.
